description: A man presents a slide show featuring a picture of himself and a woman posing cheerfully with the Devil amidst flames. This image depicts a literal interpretation of the phrase "went to hell and back," presented as a mundane vacation photo. The absurdity lies in treating the underworld as a casual tourist destination for a summer holiday. The juxtaposition of a typical slide show environment with a surreal hellish scene creates a darkly ironic commentary. The scene highlights the contrast between an extreme, supernatural location and the commonplace activity of sharing holiday memories.
caption: “Oh. Now this is from last summer, when Helen and I went to hell and back.”
